title: Diwali 2016: How much is gold? | Leicester Mercury
text:
Comments (1) 
Melton Road and Belgrave Road are famous for their jewellery shops, being home to some of the finest Indian jewellery collections in the country. 
But the stores also sell investment gold in the form of bullion and coins, and owners can offer advice on the best ways to purchase. 
The price of gold rose quite considerably following Brexit. However, the value has fallen since then and dipped to the lowest level since the EU referendum at the beginning of October – so now could be the time to invest. 
At Ram Jewellers, a 1oz gold bar will currently set you back £1,035.21. The cheapest option is the 1g bar, for £39.93, while the greatest investment would be 1kg — which you'll need a whopping £32,583.04 to buy. 
If the price of gold starts to rise again, it will be well worth the cash. 
The Golden Mile stores will also pay for your unwanted gold. Kampala Jewellers currently offers £165 for 10 grams of 22 carat gold — and £22,000 for a 1kg bar. 
You can see prices to buy and calculate prices to sell for yourself online as several of the areas jewellers have websites. 
For more visit, the websites of Ram and Kampala .
